Text:
[II] Dearest siblings, let us pray to Christ the Redeemer. Who came to save all people. Let us say with confidence:
[IR] Come, Lord Jesus!
[I1] Lord Christ, you who took on our own flesh and, through some mystery, you made known to the world the glory of your divinity,
[I2] by your advent, give us life.
[I1] You who took upon yourself our weaknesses,
[I2] grant us your mercy.
[I1] You who came in humility being born a child in a manger, and redeemed the world from sin,
[I2] when you come again redeem us of our faults, and restore all that is broken.
[I1] You who live and Reign over all creation,
[I2] out of your goodness bring us to our eternal home.
[I1] You who is seated at the right hand of the Father,
[I2] with the light of your face, give joy to the souls of the deceased.
Changes: 2021-12-05 - Paul Prins: Initial translation of these intentions.
